scenario_one_planner.goal: Validate Statement 1 by extracting the operator model, enumerating objects, reconstructing the initial state and goal, and checking the candidate plan step-by-step, reporting applicability, resulting state changes, goal achievement, and minimal repairs if needed.

private_information: No plan was provided for Statement 2.
scenario_two_planner.goal: Extract the operator model and a clean initial state and goal for Statement 2, identify enabling constraints for actions, and propose a feasible high-level plan outline or explain obstacles to solvability.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the analyses and synthesize a single consistent PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (one per statement) targeting the FastDownwards solver, preserving the exact predicate and action names and arities from the specification.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a classical-planning analyst. Using the provided public information and your private notes, extract operator schemas (name, parameters, preconditions, add, delete), enumerate the object set, reconstruct the initial state and goal for Statement 1, and validate the candidate plan step-by-step reporting applicability, resulting state deltas, and whether the goal is achieved; if invalid, propose minimal fixes. Do not produce PDDL; provide a concise, structured summary suitable for downstream orchestration.
analyze.prompt: Your name is scenario_one_planner. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->scenario_one_planner->private_information}. Objective: {agents->scenario_one_planner->goal}. Return a compact, structured summary with sections: operators, objects, initial, goal, plan_validation, suggested_repairs.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a classical-planning analyst. Using the provided public information and your private notes, extract operator schemas and a clean initial state and goal for Statement 2, identify enabling constraints for each action, and synthesize a plausible plan outline or explain obstacles to solvability. Do not produce PDDL; provide a concise, structured summary suitable for downstream orchestration.
analyze.prompt: Your name is scenario_two_planner. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->scenario_two_planner->private_information}. Objective: {agents->scenario_two_planner->goal}. Return a compact, structured summary with sections: operators, objects, initial, goal, plan_outline, feasibility_analysis.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in compiling planning tasks to PDDL for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the two analyses into a single consistent PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (one per statement). Preserve the exact predicate and action names and arities from the specification: predicates hand/1, cats/1, texture/1, vase/2, sneeze/1, spring/1, stupendous/1, next/2, collect/2; actions paltry/3, sip/3, clip/3, wretched/4, memory/3, tightfisted/3 with the given preconditions and effects. Use only STRIPS-compatible constructs and lowercase identifiers. Include all objects object_0 through object_12 in each problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and each PDDL problem between <problem id='s1'></problem> and <problem id='s2'></problem> tags.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Analysis 1: {analysis_s1}. Analysis 2: {analysis_s2}. Produce the final PDDL domain and two PDDL problems strictly aligned with the action schemas and statements; ensure FastDownwards compatibility and deterministic STRIPS; resolve any minor inconsistencies in favor of the explicit specifications.
